comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I'm afraid I'm no help here, I've scanned the crowd looking for similar shawls but few tartan and no faces that seem to resemble the other ladies. There is a brief reference to the market in the Galway Advertiser as in www.advertiser.ie/galway/article/35364 but not sure if it was the same photograph as that does not come up.

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: If you went there today (especially as the schools are off) you'd probably find some kids drinking flagons and being sick.

comment.author: 30687643@N00
comment._content: These ladies look so poor, but I notice a lot of laughter in one group at the front which makes it a lot nicer to look at. The obligatory streetview shows the buildings next to the Spanish Arch still exist though much gentrifiedhttp://g.co/maps/8x5r9

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mogey] Thanks for the streetview link. This photo now added to our Flickr map.

comment.author: 28973384@N02
comment._content:
Mogey comments that these ladies look so poor but I'm not so sure that they look poor as they look cold.  They look well clad and I'd suggest that a photo of any similar gathering at any similar market in USA, Australia or Canada in Winter  would have looked much the same.  Although, even in Winter, in Aus they might not have needed such heavy shawls.

JFL
